newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Wall Street fall seen dampening Singapore stocks.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street fall seen dampening Singapore stocks.

text.p: The Singapore stock market was likely to be dampened early Thursday after Wall Street took a breather from recent gains and fell over 139 points on Wednesday, dealers said.
However, some dealers said the opportunity remained for investors with longer time horizon to bottom-fish low-valued stocks and selected blue chips.
"Recent falls have made most Singapore stocks undervalued and they are now ripe for picking," said a dealer.
The Straits Times Industrials Index ended 12.45 points up on Wednesday at 2,068.13 while Wall Street ended 139.67 points dwon at 7,085.65.
